title: Master's Thesis - Small-Scale Hydrofoil Boat: Hardware Design
overview: This project focuses on the hardware design and construction of a small-scale radio-controlled hydrofoil boat.
The platform is intended for experimental validation of sensing and control algorithms before deployment on a full-scale solar-powered racing boat.
This work constitutes the hardware-design part of my master's thesis.
highlights: Scaled down the full-sized 'Celka' boat model and CNC-milled the mold for the hull.
Collaboratively sanded and prepared the mold surface with team members.
Laminated the carbon fiber hull inside the mold with a colleague.
Adapted the propulsion system and controller from a different boat (R.O.B.U.R.).
Electronics, foil mounting, and control systems are in progress.
results: The project is still in progress. Key milestones like electronics integration and on-water tests are planned for the coming weeks.
